conclusion: The problem involves shadows cast by four objects on a wooden floor, labeled A, B, C, and D.
The objects are a blue alarm clock, an egg, a black box with a handle, and a white object with buttons and a handle.
Shadows are formed when an object blocks light, creating a dark area behind it. The position and size of the shadow depend on the position of the light source and the object.
The light source is currently above the objects, casting shadows directly below them.
The blue alarm clock is on the left, casting shadow A directly below it.
The egg is to the right of the alarm clock, casting shadow B directly below it.
The black box is further to the left, casting shadow C directly below it.
The white object is below and to the right of the egg, casting shadow D directly below it.

premise: If the light source moves to the back left, the light will come from a higher and more leftward angle relative to the objects.
conclusion: The shadows will shift towards the front right and possibly change in size.

premise: The light source moves to the back left, affecting shadow A (blue alarm clock).
conclusion: Shadow A will move to the front right and possibly extend more towards the front.

premise: The light source moves to the back left, affecting shadow B (egg).
conclusion: Shadow B will move to the front right and possibly become longer.

premise: The light source moves to the back left, affecting shadow C (black box).
conclusion: Shadow C will move to the front right and possibly become longer.

premise: The light source moves to the back left, affecting shadow D (white object).
conclusion: Shadow D will move to the front right and possibly become longer.

premise: Considering all shadows (A, B, C, D) and the movement of the light source to the back left.
conclusion: A, B, C, and D move to the front right and become longer.
